result.execSummary:
The defendant Jessie James Jones Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: With Case No. 2015CM3713, with credit for 58 days time served.

miscConds.notes:
*Defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
*Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges by 12/19/2016. Any missing payments and/or any remaining balance at the end of probation will be due immediately or an entry of a civil judgment.
*Restitution is set at $0.
*No violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause.
*Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.

*Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant NOT possess or use any controlled substances unless by valid prescription.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jessie James Jones Jr

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    


Defendant sentenced to serve 100 days in the House of Correction, concurrent to Case No. 2015CM3713, with credit for 58 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 year.


CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
     *   No violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause.
     *   Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed
          medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.          
     *   Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
          and successfully complete recommended treatment
          including random urine screens.
     *   Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant NOT possess or
          use any controlled substances unless by valid prescription.
     *   Defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the
          DNA surcharge.
     *   Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges by 12/19/2016. 
          Any missing payments and/or any remaining balance at  
          the end of probation will be due immediately or an entry of
          an entry of a civil judgment.
     *   Restitution is set at $0.

 Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Rights and Pretrial Incarceration Credit,received and filed

Defendant Jessie James Jones in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Defendant Jessie James Jones in custody.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales in court, defendant Jessie James Jones not in court, in custody and not produced.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Defendant's appearance waived for today's proceedings. For reasons stated on the record,  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 31.    All parties are notified that effective 12-1-15 this case will be assigned to Reserved Branch, Branch 31, in Room 615 of the Courthouse.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales in court vai, defendant Jessie James Jones not in court, in custody and not produced.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for scheduling conference. Defense counsel is unavailable for today's proceedings.   Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference, Branch 37.  Scheduling conference scheduled for November 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE POINT for Supervision.
Court orders defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY and to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers. 
Court orders no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription. 

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with: Walmart.

Defendant Jessie James Jones in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Jessie James Jones in custody.  
Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: sm  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Scheduling conference scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
